newsitem.title: LATVIA: PARLIAMENT SETS UP COMMITTEE TO LOOK AT G24 LOANS.
newsitem.headline: PARLIAMENT SETS UP COMMITTEE TO LOOK AT G24 LOANS.

text.p: Latvia's parliament on Thursday voted to set up a special committee to investigate the taking and use of credits provided in the framework of the G24.
The credits, put as high as $300 million by some politicians, have been controversial as some MPs say they have been abused and not used for the purpose meant.
The committee, which will sit until June 1, has to investigate how these credits can be returned and whether anyone is guilty of squandering them, politicians said.
77 MPs backed the formation of the committee and noone opposed it.
Each parliament faction has to delegate a representative to the committee and it will probably begin sitting next week.
It is expected that largest parliament party, Saimnieks, will chair the committee.
